payload.description:
Take root summaries from one conversation and inject them as fresh roots into another, enabling context continuity after accidental /new.

Design:
- Copy condensed/root summary CONTENT as new entries (new IDs, target conversation_id)
- No cross-conversation references — standalone roots in the new DAG
- Insert as first context_items, shift existing ordinals up

UI options:
- t key on conversation view: transplant picker
- CLI: lcm-tui transplant --from <old-session> --to <new-session>

Key insight: /new does not destroy data. The problem is the new conversation starts blank with no link to prior context.
payload.title: Summary transplant: carry forward context across /new boundaries

payload.description: Add 'lcm-tui repair <conversation_id>' CLI subcommand to detect and re-summarize corrupted summary nodes. See specs/repair-corrupted-summaries.md. Bottom-up DAG repair: leaves first, then condensed. Dry-run by default, --apply to write. Uses Anthropic API directly.
payload.title: Repair corrupted summaries (CLI subcommand)

payload.description:
## Overview

Two related UX improvements to make lcm-tui self-sufficient for LCM operations without needing to query the database directly.

## 1. Surface IDs Throughout the UI

Currently the LCM conversation_id (e.g. 642) and summary IDs (e.g. sum_52d9dd2ff6735eff) are internal DB values not shown anywhere in the TUI. Users need to query SQLite directly to use CLI tools like dissolve.

**Changes needed:**
- Show `conv_id: NNN` in the conversation list and/or conversation header/detail view
- Show summary IDs in the Summary DAG view (each node should display its ID)
- Make IDs copyable or at least visible for reference

## 2. Interactive Dissolve in DAG View

The dissolve command (dissolve.go) already exists as a CLI subcommand. Wire it into the Bubble Tea DAG view as an interactive operation.

**UX flow:**
1. User navigates to a condensed summary node in the DAG view
2. Press `d` to initiate dissolve
3. Show confirmation screen with dry-run info:
   - List of parent summaries that would be restored
   - Token impact (current tokens → restored tokens, delta)
   - Number of ordinal shifts required
4. `y` to confirm and execute, `n` or Esc to cancel
5. After execution, refresh the DAG view to show updated state

**Implementation notes:**
- dissolve.go already has the core logic (DissolveSummary function with dry-run support)
- Need a confirmation modal/overlay in Bubble Tea
- DAG view refresh after mutation
- Consider showing a brief success/failure message after execution

## Acceptance Criteria

- Conversation IDs visible in conversation list/detail
- Summary IDs visible on each node in the DAG view
- Press `d` on a condensed node in DAG view triggers dissolve flow
- Confirmation screen shows dry-run preview before executing
- DAG view refreshes after successful dissolve
payload.title: Show conversation/summary IDs in TUI + interactive dissolve in DAG view
